results.justification: The document explicitly states the research aims to understand how educators design learning experiences using the BDP tool, employing clustering and correlation analyses.
Sections 3.1 and 3.2 provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the data extraction, preprocessing, clustering, and correlation analysis procedures.
The raw or processed datasets are not publicly available. While the BDP tool is mentioned, access to the specific dataset used in the study is not provided.
The document states data was used from 2022-2023 for which designers gave consent, implying privacy concerns are addressed through consent.
Section 3.1 details the features extracted from the TLA data, effectively serving as a data dictionary. The variables, their levels, and the data structure are explained.
The document describes the data collection method as extracting data from the BDP tool, specifying the time frame (2022-2023) and the number of educators and LDs included (165 educators, 218 LDs).
The document states: "the source code with full details is available at https://github.com/josmarios/ld-clustering".
Code is shared, so justification is not needed.
The document states the code for data preparation is available at the same link as the analysis code: https://github.com/josmarios/ld-clustering.
The document clearly describes the statistical methods used, including k-modes clustering, Pearson correlation coefficients, and the elbow method.
Effect sizes (R^2), confidence intervals, and p-values are reported in Table 4.
The study is primarily quantitative. While cluster profiles are described, there is limited subjective context or interpretation beyond the statistical findings.
The study is primarily quantitative, so data coding and analysis are not applicable.
Results are presented in tables (e.g., Table 1, Table 2, Table 3, Table 4) and figures (e.g., Figure 2, Figure 3, Figure 4), with clear descriptions accompanying them.
Section 5.1 explicitly discusses limitations, including potential bias from the BDP tool, the limited number of clusters, and the lack of exploration of causal relationships.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration on platforms like the Open Science Foundation.
